sample.definition:
1) take a sample of
3) all or part of a natural object that is collected and preserved as an example of its class

3) an assortment of various samples

1) (statistics) the selection of a suitable sample for study

sand.definition:
1) a loose material consisting of grains of rock or coral

meanings.definition: a loose material consisting of grains of rock or coral
French writer known for works concerning women's rights and independence (1804-1876)

sandal.definition: a shoe consisting of a sole fastened by straps to the foot

sane.definition: mentally healthy; free from mental disorder

speak more sanely about these affairs
she is behaving rather sanely these days even though we know she is schizophrenic

2) the act of soaking thoroughly with a liquid

swat.definition: hit swiftly with a violent blow

swath.definition:
1) the space created by the swing of a scythe or the cut of a mowing machine
2) a path or strip (as cut by one course of mowing)

swathing.definition: cloth coverings wrapped around something (as a wound or a baby)

swatter.definition: splash and flutter about in or as if in water

examples.en: She swattered about in the pool

swazi.definition:
1) of or relating to or characteristic of Swaziland or its people or their language
2) a Bantu language closely related to Zulu

swaziland.definition: a landlocked monarchy in southeastern Africa; member of the commonwealth that achieved independence from the United Kingdom in 1968

swear.definition:
3) promise solemnly; take an oath
4) make a deposition; declare under oath

swearer.definition:
1) someone who uses profanity
2) someone who takes a solemn oath

sweat.definition:
1) excrete perspiration through the pores in the skin
3) condensation of moisture on a cold surface
examples: the cold glasses were streaked with sweat
Exercise makes one sweat

meanings.definition: excrete perspiration through the pores in the skin
examples: Exercise makes one sweat

antonyms: the cold glasses were streaked with sweat

sweatband.definition:
1) a band of fabric or leather sewn inside the crown of a hat
2) a band of material tied around the forehead or wrist to absorb sweat

sweatbox.definition:
1) small or narrow cell
2) a device that causes tobacco leaves or fruit or hides to sweat

sweater.definition: a crocheted or knitted garment covering the upper part of the body

sweatshirt.definition: cotton knit pullover with long sleeves worn during athletic activity

sweatshop.definition: factory where workers do piecework for poor pay and are prevented from forming unions; common in the clothing industry

swede.definition: a native or inhabitant of Sweden

sweden.definition: a Scandinavian kingdom in the eastern part of the Scandinavian Peninsula

swedish.definition: of or relating to or characteristic of Sweden or its people or culture or language

sweep.definition:
1) a wide scope
2) move with sweeping, effortless, gliding motions
3) sweep with a broom or as if with a broom

examples.en: The diva swept into the room
Shreds of paper sailed through the air
Sweep the crumbs off the table

sweeper.definition:
1) an employee who sweeps (floors or streets etc.)
3) little-known nocturnal fish of warm shallow seas with an oblong compressed body

sweeping.definition:
1) taking in or moving over (or as if over) a wide area; often used in combination
2) ignoring distinctions

examples.en: a wide-sweeping view of the river
he sweepingly condemned the entire population of the country for the war crimes

sweepstakes.definition: a lottery in which the prize consists of the money paid by the participants

sweet.definition:
1) having or denoting the characteristic taste of sugar
3) a food rich in sugar
4) pleasing to the senses

examples.en: the sweet song of the lark
the sweet face of a child

sweet-breathed.definition: having breath or breath as specified

sweetbrier.definition: Eurasian rose with prickly stems and fragrant leaves and bright pink flowers followed by scarlet hips

sweeten.definition:
1) make sweeter in taste
2) make sweeter, more pleasant, or more agreeable

sweetening.definition:
1) something added to foods to make them taste sweeter
3) the act of adding a sweetener to food

sweet-faced.definition: having a pleasing face or one showing a sweet disposition

sweetheart.definition:
1) privileged treatment of a favored person or corporation (sometimes unethically)
2) any well-liked individual

examples.en: another sweetheart deal based on political influence

sweetleaf.definition: small yellowwood tree of southern United States having small fragrant white flowers; leaves and bark yield a yellow dye

sweetly.definition: in an affectionate or loving manner (`sweet' is sometimes a poetic or informal variant of `sweetly')

examples.en: Susan Hayward plays the wife sharply and sweetly
how sweet the moonlight sleeps upon this bank"- Shakespeare

sweetmeat.definition: a sweetened delicacy (as a preserve or pastry)

sweetness.definition: the property of tasting as if it contains sugar

sweetsop.definition:
1) tropical American tree bearing sweet pulpy fruit with thick scaly rind and shiny black seeds
2) sweet pulpy tropical fruit with thick scaly rind and shiny black seeds

swell.definition:
1) increase in size, magnitude, number, or intensity
2) become filled with pride, arrogance, or anger
3) expand abnormally

examples.en: The music swelled to a crescendo
The mother was swelling with importance when she spoke of her son
The bellies of the starving children are swelling

swelling.definition: an abnormal protuberance or localized enlargement

swelter.definition:
1) be uncomfortably hot
2) suffer from intense heat

examples.en: we were sweltering at the beach

sweltering.definition: excessively hot and humid or marked by sweating and faintness

examples.en: the sleek swept wings of the plane

sweptback.definition: (especially of aircraft wings) angled rearward from the point of attachment

swertia.definition: genus of herbs of mountains of North America and Eurasia and Africa

examples.en: The car cut to the left at the intersection
The motorbike veered to the right

swift.definition:
1) United States meat-packer who began the use of refrigerated railroad cars (1839-1903)
2) an English satirist born in Ireland (1667-1745)
3) a small bird that resembles a swallow and is noted for its rapid flight

swiftlet.definition: swift of eastern Asia; produces the edible bird's nest

swill.definition: drink large quantities of (liquid, especially alcoholic drink)

swim.definition:
1) travel through water
3) be dizzy or giddy
4) be covered with or submerged in a liquid

examples.en: We had to swim for 20 minutes to reach the shore
a big fish was swimming in the tank
my brain is swimming after the bottle of champagne
the meat was swimming in a fatty gravy

swimmer.definition:
1) a trained athlete who participates in swimming meets
2) a person who travels through the water by swimming

examples.en: he is not a good swimmer

swimmeret.definition: one of the paired abdominal appendages of certain aquatic crustaceans that function primarily for carrying the eggs in females and are usually adapted for swimming

examples.en: it was the swimming they enjoyed most": "they took a short swim in the pool

swimsuit.definition: tight fitting garment worn for swimming
swimsuit.brief: tight fitting garment worn for swimming

meanings.definition: tight fitting garment worn for swimming

swindle.definition: the act of swindling by some fraudulent scheme

swindler.definition: a person who swindles you by means of deception or fraud

swing.definition:
1) move in a curve or arc, usually with the intent of hitting
2) move or walk in a swinging or swaying manner
3) change direction with a swinging motion; turn

examples.en: swingeing damages awarded by the judge

swinger.definition:
1) someone who swings sports implements
2) a person who engages freely in promiscuous sex

swishy.definition: resembling a sustained `sh' or soft whistle

swiss.definition: of or relating to Switzerland or its people or culture

switch.definition:
1) control consisting of a mechanical or electrical or electronic device for making or breaking or changing the connections in a circuit
3) lay aside, abandon, or leave for another
4) make a shift in or exchange of; then we switched"

examples.en: switch to a different brand of beer

switchblade.definition: a pocketknife with a blade that springs open at the press of a button

switchboard.definition: telephone central where circuits are completed with patchcords

switcher.definition: a person who administers punishment by wielding a switch or whip

switch-hit.definition: bat right-handed against a left-handed and left-handed against a right-handed pitcher

switch-hitter.definition:
1) a baseball player who can bat either right or left handed
2) slang term for a bisexual person

switchman.definition: a man who operates railroad switches

switzerland.definition: a landlocked federal republic in central Europe

swivel.definition: a coupling (as in a chain) that has one end that turns on a headed pin

examples.en: it threw her into a swivet

swizzle.definition: any of various tall frothy mixed drinks made usually of rum and lime juice and sugar shaken with ice

swoop.definition:
1) (music) rapid sliding up or down the musical scale
2) move with a sweep, or in a swooping arc
3) seize or catch with a swooping motion

examples.en: the violinist was indulgent with his swoops and slides

swoosh.definition: the noise produced by the sudden rush of a fluid (a gas or liquid)

sword.definition: a cutting or thrusting weapon that has a long metal blade and a hilt with a hand guard

swordfish.definition:
1) flesh of swordfish usually served as steaks
2) large toothless marine food fish with a long swordlike upper jaw; not completely cold-blooded i.e. they are able to warm their brains and eyes: worldwide in warm waters but feed on cold ocean floor coming to surface at night

swordtail.definition: freshwater fish of Central America having a long swordlike tail; popular aquarium fish

sworn.definition: bound by or stated on oath

examples.en: now my sworn friend and then mine enemy"- Shakespeare

swot.definition: an insignificant student who is ridiculed as being affected or boringly studious

szechwan.definition: a populous province of south central China

szilard.definition: United States physicist and molecular biologist who helped develop the first atom bomb and later opposed the use of all nuclear weapons (1898-1964)
